title: Common Issues : F Matrix
text: non-numeric argument binary operator error can mean F matrix extra columns . * ref

title: Common Issues : F Matrix
text: ‘x’ must array least two dimension https://github.com/phytoclass/phytoclass/issues/11

title: Common Issues : F Matrix
text: Error x[subset & !.na(subset), vars, drop = drop] : subscript bounds https://github.com/phytoclass/phytoclass/issues/12 error can happen sample names included S matrix. Current version phytoclass support sample names.

title: Common Issues : F Matrix
text: Error rowSums(Fmat) : ‘x’ must numeric can mean F matrix numeric index (1,2,3,etc) column must removed. sometimes introduced read.csv readRDS. workaround :
code: # === remove numeric rownames introduced by read.csv if (all(grepl("^[0-9]+$", rownames(F_matrix)))) {   print("dropping unneeded numeric index")   # Set the first column as row names   rownames(F_matrix) <- F_matrix[[1]]      # Remove the first column   F_matrix <- F_matrix[, -1]  }

title: Example : Minimal
text: run phytoclass must prepare sample matrix (aka S matrix). recommend creating comma-separated-value (.csv) file. Several example files included ./vignettes/ directory phytoclass source code. .csv files can created plain text editor. example S-matrix .csv file content: example includes 14 samples (rows), pigment concentration sample included row. 14 minumum number rows required apply simulated annealing. first row includes names pigment. pigment abbreviations must match exactly pigments F-matrix. example using default phytoclass:Fm F matrix, column names example used. NOTE: Instead using plain text editor, .csv files can also created using spreadsheet editor (MS Excel, Google Docs, LibreOffice Calc, etc.) using “save ” “export” .csv.

title: Example : Minimal
text: run simulated annealing call function S matrix passed argument.
code: # load the sample matrix from a file S_matrix <- read.csv("vignettes/custom-example-S.csv")  # run simulated annealing  results <- phytoclass::simulated_annealing(S_matrix)

title: Example : Minimal
text: Results simulated annealing run results object returned function.
code: results$`condition number` results$RMSE results$MAE results$Error results$`Class abundances` results$Figure

title: The phytoclass package
text: phytoclass package uses non-negative matrix factorization simulated annealing determine biomass different phytoplankton groups pigment concentrations. methodology discussed (Hayward, Pinkerton, Gutierrez‐Rodriguez 2023) similar CHEMTAX method Mackey et al. (1996). ease use, functions default options. However user also option set parameters within program, instructions listed function. important highlight naming conventions phytoplankton groups pigments adhered using default samples. example, user ensure pigment names sample matrix (S) match pigment names pigment – Chl ratio matrix (F). present use DV Chl Prochlorococcus supported, however future release. main function package simulated_annealing() associated helper function Cluster() helper functions covered document : Matrix_checks Bounded_weights Steepest_Desc NNLS_MF

title: The phytoclass package
text: main function phytoclass package. takes inputs (listed ) returns updated pigment Chl ratios, Chl biomass phytoplankton group, error associated group, graph displaying Chl concentration group. important samples clustered appropriately using function (see Cluster function). Arguments: S = Sample matrix – matrix pigment samples. Ensure Chl final column F = Pigment Chl matrix. left blank default values used. Ensure pigment columns order S column naming conventions match. user_defined_min_max = blank default values used. create different min_max values, follow structure phytoclass::min_max file. See example . do_matrix_checks = set true using default values. remove pigment columns column sums 0. Set FALSE using customised names pigments phytoplankton groups. niter = number iterations. Default value 500. step = step ratio used. Default value 0.009. weight.upper.bound = upper limit weights applied. Default value 30. using default values, argument required sample matrix. However, make sure pigment names match built-pigment Chl matrix Fm. examples follow argument niter equals one processing speed, set much higher obtain convergence.

title: The phytoclass package
text: Prior analysis using simulated annealing, pigment samples require clustering. Cluster function divides pigment concentrations total Chl concentration. Following data undergoes BoxCox transformation, data hierarchically clustered using Ward method based Manhattan distances pigment samples. DynamicTreeCut method (Langfelder, Zhang, Horvath 2008) used prune dendogram reasonable clusters specified size(s). function returns list clusters cluster dendrogram. example, using built-sample data set Sm:

title: The phytoclass package
The phytoclass package
The phytoclass package
text: function perform checks F S matrices. columns sum 0 small eliminated S F matrix. use function, naming pigments phytoplankton classes must follow conventions default values. output function new S F matrices. Arguments: S = S matrix F = F matrix
code: MC <- Matrix_checks(Sm, Fm)   Snew <- MC$Snew Fnew <- MC$Fnew

title: The phytoclass package
text: algorithm perform steepest descent algorithm without bound limits. results may show unrealistic pig:Chl ratios certain groups, although error can often low. Arguments: F = F matrix S = S matrix num.loops = number loops/iterations perform
code: MC <- Matrix_checks(Sm, Fm)   Snew <- MC$Snew Fnew <- MC$Fnew SDRes <- Steepest_Desc(Fnew, Snew, num.loops = 10)

title: The phytoclass package
text: function determines weights use S matrix, default upper bound 30 simulated_annealing() function call. Arguments: S = sample matrix weight.upper.bound = maximum weights upper bound

title: The phytoclass package
text: performs non-negative least least squares matrix factorization S F matrices. Ensure Chl final column columns S F order. weights left blank weights used. Arguments: Fn = F matrix S = sample matrix cm = weights column

what: Estimate Chla Concentrations of Phytoplankton Groups
title: Estimate Chla Concentrations of Phytoplankton Groups
text: phytoclass package uses non-negative matrix factorization simulated annealing determine chl concentrations different phytoplankton groups pigment concentrations. main function ‘Simulated annealing’. can used conjuction cluster function, clusters larger datasets. understand use matrices instead default dataset, please see example vignette. setting matrices, important ensure pigments order Sm Fm matrices. Chlorophyll must final column. separate function Divinyl chlorophyll Prochlorococcus used. Divynl chlorophyll must 2nd last column (see ‘Fp’). ’Steepest Descent’function similar CHEMTAX, unconstrained minimum maximum values, unlike simualted annealing function. use caution.
